Carfield Yim wrote:
> Yes, I feel we should carefully design what should be inject and what
> should be just create, I am maintaining a project that inject object
> everywhere, and how nearly hundred of XML configuration files. Not
> easy to maintain and change.

How in the world do you manage and test a hundred XML files?
Can anyone understand what they are configuring?

To me, this cure looks worse than the disease.

I've been following up research on some of the ideas posted in this 
thread, such as Application Context. Perhaps it can work, but
having "hundred of XML" files to save a couple of singletons is an iffy 
engineering decision to me. And the alternative seems to be to implement 
an LDAP server, which is even more baroque.

I love the simplicity of JUnit. I hate the insane complexity of much of 
J2EE. Perhaps I'm just too old, but if this is the solution, perhaps 
we're asking the wrong question?
